Video Title: CBT for PTSD: Example of how grounding techniques can be used in therapy
Patient Concern Summary: The patient is suffering from Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) disorder and wanted to get rid of it through suitable therapy treatment.
Doctor Suggestion Summary: The doctor suggested the grounding technique. This technique asks her to find five things she can see, four things she can touch, three things she can hear, two things she can smell, and one thing she can taste.

Video Title: CBT for Social Anxiety Disorder: Using downward arrow and thought challenging techniques
Patient Concern Summary: The patient is having social anxiety while going to work. She doesn't believe in her own worth. She has close friends about whom she cares a lot.
Doctor Suggestion Summary: The doctor did an exercise with her to let her know that it's not that she doesn't have a sense of self-worth, but she is choosing to be restricted by people.Â
